verses.text: O death, how bitter is the remembrance of thee to a man that liveth at rest in his possessions, Unto the man that hath nothing to vex him, and that hath prosperity in all \add things:\add* Yea unto him that is yet able to receive meat!

O death, acceptable is thy sentence unto the needy, And unto him whose strength faileth, that is now in the last age, And is vexed with all \add things\add*, And to him that despaireth, and hath lost patience!
Fear not the sentence of death, Remember them \add that have been\add* before thee, and \add that\add* come after; For this \add is\add* the sentence of the Lord over all flesh.
And why art thou against the pleasure of the most High? There is no inquisition in the grave, Whether thou have lived ten, or an hundred, or a thousand years.
The children of sinners are abominable children, And they that are conversant in the dwelling of the ungodly.
The inheritance of sinners’ children shall perish, And their posterity shall have a perpetual reproach.
The children will complain of an ungodly father, Because they shall be reproached for his sake.
Woe be unto you, ungodly men, Which have forsaken the law of the most high God! For if you increase, \add it shall be\add* to \add your\add* destruction:
And if you be born, you shall be born to a curse; And if you die, a curse shall be your portion.
All that \add are\add* of the earth shall turn to earth \add again:\add* So the ungodly \add shall go\add* from a curse to destruction.
The mourning of men \add is\add* about their bodies: But an ill name of sinners shall be blotted out.
Have regard to \add thy\add* name; for that shall continue with thee Above a thousand great treasures of gold.
A good life hath \add but\add* few days: But a good name endureth for ever.
\add My\add* children, keep discipline in peace: For wisdom that is hid, and a treasure \add that is\add* not seen, What profit \add is\add* in \add them\add* both?
A man that hideth his foolishness \add is\add* better Than a man that hideth his wisdom.
Therefore be shamefast according to my word: For it is not good to retain all shamefastness; Neither is it altogether approved in every \add thing\add*.
Be ashamed of whoredom before father and mother: And of a lie before a prince and a mighty man;
Of an offence before a judge and ruler; Of iniquity before a congregation and people; Of unjust dealing before \add thy\add* partner and friend;

And of theft in regard of the place where thou sojournest, And in regard of the truth of God and \add his\add* covenant; And to lean with \add thine\add* elbow upon the meat; And of scorning to give and take;
And of silence before them that salute \add thee;\add* And to look upon a harlot;
And to turn away thy face from \add thy\add* kinsman; \add Or\add* to take away a portion or a gift; Or to gaze upon another man’s wife;
\add Or\add* to be overbusy with his maid, And come not near her bed; \add Or\add* of upbraiding speeches before friends; And after \add thou\add* hast given, upbraid not;
Or of iterating and speaking \add again\add* that which \add thou\add* hast heard; And of revealing of secrets.
So shalt thou be truly shamefast, And find favour before all men.
